title: Saint Louis University â€“ BS Architecture Program (BSAR)
program_learning_outcomes: Pursue continuing professional development in the field of architecture.
Communicate effectively in oral and written forms, both in English and Filipino.
Work effectively and independently in multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural teams.
Recognize and uphold professional, social, and ethical responsibility.

Create architectural solutions and ecologically responsible designs using knowledge in history, theory, planning, building technology and utilities, structural concepts, professional practice, and principles of sustainability.
Integrate concepts and principles from specialized fields and allied disciplines into various architectural problems.
Prepare contract documents, technical reports, and other legal documents used in architectural practice, adhering to applicable laws, standards, and regulations.
Apply relevant laws, codes, charters, and standards of architecture and the built environment.
Apply research methods to address architectural problems.
Utilize various information and communication technology (ICT) tools for architectural solutions, presentations, and techniques in design and construction.
Acquire entrepreneurial and business acumen relevant to architectural practice.
Manage construction works, building administration, and other architecture-related services.
Participate in the generation of new knowledge and developmental projects.
Practice Christian values in their personal and professional endeavors as Louisians in the service of the CICM mission.
